snippet: While general-interest publications struggle to get readers to pay for online content, wine publications seem to draw customers who are willing to pony up. Well-known critics like Robert Parker and Jancis Robinson have long had paid-for sites. The...
abstract: While general-interest publications struggle to get readers to pay for online content, wine publications seem to draw customers who are willing to pony up. Well-known critics like Robert Parker and Jancis Robinson have long had paid-for sites. The latest digital newsletter, The Feiring Line, is due to start this month.

headline.main: Wine News Online: A Paying Proposition
